extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pound medium or large shrimp, peeled and deveined
extendedIngredients.originalName: or large shrimp, peeled and deveined

title: Lowcountry Breakfast Shrimp
summary: Lowcountry Breakfast Shrimp is a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian recipe with 8 servings. One portion of this dish contains around 24g of protein, 10g of fat, and a total of 203 calories. For $2.48 per serving, this recipe covers 13% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works well as a budget friendly main course. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. Head to the store and pick up scallion, kosher salt, butter, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the unsalted butter you could follow this main course with the Almond Milk Chocolate Pudding as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 25 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 33%. This score is rather bad. Try Lowcountry Shrimp and Grits, Lowcountry Shrimp Pilaf, and Lowcountry Shrimp-and-Okra Pilau for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 99 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Preparation                                                        Heat butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium heat until foaming, then cook onions with scallion, garlic, salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, stirring occasionally, until softened but not browned, about 5 minutes. Add shrimp and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add 1/2 cup water and simmer gently, stirring, until shrimp are just cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes (shrimp should be saucy; add more water if necessary). Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

steps.step: Heat butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium heat until foaming, then cook onions with scallion, garlic, salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, stirring occasionally, until softened but not browned, about 5 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook, stirring, 1 minute.

Add 1/2 cup water and simmer gently, stirring, until shrimp are just cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes (shrimp should be saucy; add more water if necessary). Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.
